title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 14
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey 

The General Classification saw one big mover, as Guillaume Martin shot up to second overall from ninth, courtesy of gaining five and a half minutes in the day's breakaway. His fellow escape companion, Matteo Cattaneo, also headed into the top ten.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Guillaume Martin +4:04
3. Rigoberto Urán +5:18
4. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
5. Richard Carapaz +5:33
6. Ben O'Connor +5:58
7. Wilco Kelderman +6:16
8. Alexey Lutsenko +6:30
9. Enric Mas +7:11
10. Mattia Cattaneo +9:48

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

Though closest rival Matthews gained eight points, Mark Cavendish has an emphatic lead in this competition for Deceuninck Quick-Step and comfortably made the time cut. 

1. Mark Cavendish - 279 points
2. Michael Matthews - 187 points
3. Jasper Philipsen - 174 points
4. Sonny Colbrelli - 159 points
5. Julian Alaphilippe - 131 points

The Tour de France jerseys – the race so far

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

Vying with Wout Poels in the breakaway for the points, Michael Woods emerged with the jersey, though it's all to play for with small gaps and big Pyrenean days to come.

1. MIchael Woods - 54 points
2. Nairo Quintana - 50 points
3. Wout Poels - 49 points
4. Wout van Aert - 43 points
5. Bauke Mollema - 41 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

The Young Rider's Classification stayed the same after today's rolling stage.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +5:32
3. Aurélien Paret-Peintre +24:44
4. David Gaudu +30:51
5. Sergio Higuita +49:04

Team Classification

1. Bahrain Victorious
2. EF Education-Nippo +13:19
3. AG2R Citroen +16:21
4. Ineos Grenadiers +20:48
5. Bora Hansgrohe +27:03

Cover image: A.S.O./Pauline Ballet
author: Peter Stuart
